entry.title: New release for RomM: v3.0.2
entry.content:
[!CAUTION]
This build has a critical bug that may cause RomM to fail to start, we recommend staying on 3.0.1 until a fix is released.

[!WARNING]
RomM has been organized in github and dockerhub! New images will be upload to rommapp/romm repository on dockerhub and ghcr.

Added

  • Famicon disk system to emulatorjs
  • Allow setting PUID/GUID/UMASK with environment variables
  • Re-added external redis support. You can now use an external redis instance with RomM by setting REDIS_HOST and REDIS_PORT in the env variables. If you have those variables currently set but want to use the internal one, you'll have to remove those them.

Changed

  • Added scrolling to scan logs
  • Disabled amiga emulator until bios support added
  • Updated docker-compose.example.yml file to match new dockerhub rommapp organization

Fixed

  • Normalized IGDB search for better results
  • Fixed player viewport to fit screen better
  • Fixed safari downloads file names

entry.title: New release for RomM: v3.0.3
entry.content:
Fixed

  • Removed PUID/GUID environment variables
  • We're still working on getting RomM running with a non-root user, so as of this release it still needs to be run as root
  • Fix running when REDIS_HOST env variable isn't set

entry.title: New release for RomM: v3.2.0
entry.content:
BIOS file support

We've added the ability to mount (or upload) your BIOS/firmware files for any of the supported platforms. On top of that, when playing in browser with our EmulatorJS integration, you'll now be able to select both a BIOS file to load, and a core (when the system supports more then 1 core). Refer to the EmulatorJS for the complete list of available cores for each system.

Sharable & private notes

When viewing a game, you might notice a new tab called "Notes"; this is your notepad, a blank space to jot down just about anything. With full Markdown support, you have complete control over the style and layout of your note. You're also able to make the note "public" (using the little eye icon next to the pencil), that is visible to every logged-in user on your instance. And if they do the same, you'll get access to their note, for easy sharing of tips and tricks.

||| |---|---| |||

Performance improvements

On collections of 1000+ games/platforms with 250+ roms, we've measured a 10x to 20x improvement in load times. RomM should now feel faster regardless of the size of your collection, with smoother gallery navigation, faster loading of games on scroll, and real pagination support in the list view.

entry.title: New release for RomM: v3.3.0
entry.content:
What's Changed

  • UI complete redesign by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/934
  • Covers are now fetch in their 1080p version by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/934
  • Now sibling roms can have different covers by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/934
  • Screenshots are fetch in their big version by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/934
  • Setup wizard added for new RomM installations by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/976
  • Added collections by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/964
  • Add favourites collection as special collection by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/977
  • SteamGridDB integration. Roms and collections can be edited with a SteamGridDB cover by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/960
  • Enhanced scan logs by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/965
  • Select main sibling added for merged roms in gallery by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/963
  • Allow users to edit their own profile by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/975
  • Fixed firmware drawer permissions by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/956
  • Added total filesize endpoint by @adamantike in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/969
  • Improved Docker image size by @adamantike in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/947
  • Install redis instead of building in Dockerfile by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/945
  • Fix section links and improve grammar/spelling in README.md by @TylerVigario in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/914
  • Add trunk.io checks by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/868
  • Add parallel-n64 to cores by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/923
  • Use core icon when showing version by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/922
  • Add interactive table of contents by @Nicmorris1820 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/924
  • Added linuxserver/mariadb as alternative by @need4swede in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/926
  • Added large carousel on screnshot click by @zurdi15 in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/932
  • Resources structure migrated from resources/{platform_slug}/{rom_name} to resources/roms/{platform_id}/{rom_id}.
  • Disabled zip compression on streaming multi-file download to increase speed by @adamantike in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/983
  • Prevent mass-purging of roms during scan if filesystem is not correctly mounted by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/987
  • Fixed abort scan by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/1004
  • Added support for any kind of image extension on custom covers by @gantoine in https://github.com/rommapp/romm/pull/1002
  • Fixes and improvements everywhere
